channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Edge
channel.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lightning
channel.desc: Comedian Zoe Lyons presents the electrifyingly fast quiz with a ?3,000 jackpot. Six plucky contestants compete across six rounds testing their general knowledge, quick thinking and speedy reactions whilst our ruthless spotlight patrols the studio.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: In South Africa there is a daring plan to save the rhino by moving a whole population to a secret location. However, the only way out is by dangling them underneath a helicopter. Can they be moved before the poachers reach them?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Grand Pier at Weston-super-Mare in Somerset, where experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt pick out some gems to value. Among them are rare medals that once belonged to an early aviator and puppets that look like the Swedish band ABBA. Plus, Paul delves into the history of seaside entertainment.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former winners Mark Chapman, Will Kirk, Amanda Lamb and Rachel Parris take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson's sisters, Dawn and Joanna, join the actor to share a family mini break in Northumberland. Robson takes his sisters to sample underwater views by snorkelling in the North Sea at Beadnell before going with them on a sidecar trip.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: Paul explores the upper reaches of the river Dee, which rises higher than any river in the UK. In the heart of the Cairngorm mountains, he learns about writer and mountain lover Nan Shepherd's passion for the living landscape.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Kirsty and Brian visit Beechgrove Garden's June Border, part of the plot designed and planted to look its best in June.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Clara Amfo and Lauren Laverne are live on the early evening of the first full day of music. They introduce performances from across the stages, including the debuts of Alanis Morissette and En Vogue.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley are live from Glastonbury Festival as they get ready for the first headliner of the weekend, The 1975.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI XL
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts a `ruff and reddy episode in which she takes a look at ruffs and red things with Alan Davies, Tom Allen, Susan Calman and Zoe Lyons.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: Guz Khan introduces the fabulous Kiri Pritchard-McLean and the amazing Rhys James.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Clara Amfo and Jack Saunders present highlights from the Park Studio as the first full day of music at Glastonbury Festival heads into the early hours.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: Marianna Spring investigates the rise of health conspiracy theories. Are social media companies' algorithms pushing potentially harmful content at vulnerable patients?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: As America joins Israel to prevent Iran from making a nuclear weapon, the conflict in the Middle East risks further escalation. With Iran promising 'everlasting consequences' following the US use of 'bunker busting' bombs against what it insists is its peaceful nuclear programme, reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi examines what might happen next. The programme hears from those living under fire in both Iran and Israel, and examines America's claim to have 'obliterated' Iran's nuclear programme.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: To Be Announced
channel.desc: The programming for this time slot has yet to be determined and is being confirmed by the broadcast channel.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: To Be Announced
channel.desc: The programming for this time slot has yet to be determined and is being confirmed by the broadcast channel.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
channel.desc: The heroes set out on a quest to find out who is draining colour from the forest and muster all their positivity to save it from greyness.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: The Lemmings play marbles, and it's driving Grizzy crazy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: Grizzy exchanges his indifferent fish with the Lemmings' affectionate and lively fish.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pok?mon Horizons: The Series
channel.desc: Roy and Fuecoco make singing their strategy in a Tera Training usage test against Ryme.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: Little Bro Callum sets Adam and Joe another epic quest: become a king, build the best cardboard castle, and defend your kingdom against the destructive dragon.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Operation Ouch!
channel.desc: Dan and Raph work their chests, while Chris and Xand find out why blood tastes of metal!

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Peter
channel.desc: BP visits St George's Park, the home of England's national teams.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Longmeadow is exploding with summer colour, and Monty is potting up scented pelargoniums for their fragrance. Meanwhile, Toby Buckland visits horticultural gem Stockton Bury Gardens in Herefordshire.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Earth's Wildest Waters: The Big Fish
channel.desc: The seven anglers leave the freezing cold of Iceland for the tropical heat of Cuba - but violent storms make conditions tough. In the salt flats a couple of hours south of Havana they chase the ghostly bonefish, in the Bay of Pigs they must fish Cuban style - on simple tyre tube boats, and finally on the Atlantic Coast they're after giant tarpon, the `silver king'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Farming Life
channel.desc: In central Scotland near Loch Lomond, Bobby and Anne must gather their pregnant ewes from the hills ready for lambing and all the family help out. Bobby's father's 90th birthday is looming and thoughts turn to who will run the farm when it's time to hand it on to the next generation.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Definitive coverage of the world's greatest music festival across the BBC.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Definitive coverage of the world's greatest music festival across the BBC.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon focuses on the incredible characters he's met while travelling the globe and catches up with a ten-year-old boy he met working in terrible conditions in Bangladesh.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jo Whiley bring all the action from Saturday night at Glastonbury Festival.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: A look back on all of the big performances of day two at the festival, including special guests, a recap on the headliners and all the big stories from around Worthy Farm.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Master Cheng
channel.desc: After the death of his wife, the Chinese chef Cheng sets out to a remote village in Finland to meet an old friend. There he works in a caf? and inspires the residents with Chinese cuisine.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Kirsty and Brian visit Beechgrove Garden's June Border, part of the plot designed and planted to look its best in June.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Derek Brockway is in the Vale of Glamorgan on a walk of contrasts. On his journey he takes part in a lifeboat challenge, walks a guide dog puppy, sledges down a spectacular sand dune, rides a horse on Ogmore beach and fishes off the rocks.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Landward
channel.desc: Dougie and the team present highlights from this year's Royal Highland Show. Cammy joins the annual Grand Parade to celebrate the show winners.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Wimbledon Tennis
channel.desc: On the eve of the 2025 Championships, here is a chance to relive 2024's Wimbledon, which saw a familiar face win the men's singles and a surprise in the women's event.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The 39 Steps
channel.desc: Richard Hannay, pursued by the police for a murder he did not commit, and by an international spy-ring for information he does not possess, finds himself fleeing across the desolate Scottish moors, handcuffed to a beautiful blonde.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: North by Northwest
channel.desc: Roger O Thornhill is an advertising executive mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies led by James Vandamm. Initially bemused, when he is accused of murdering a UN official he is forced to go on the run. He survives murderous attacks in both auction rooms and deserted cornfields of the Midwest, leading to one of cinema's most memorable climaxes on Mount Rushmore.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Why...?
channel.desc: Dramatic mobile phone video and eyewitness accounts tell the story of the 2024 floods that swept through towns in Valencia, killing 228 people. Did climate change play a part?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Definitive coverage of the world's greatest music festival across the BBC.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the county of Moray in the north of Scotland. Brodie Castle has been home to the Brodie clan for some 800 years, and Fiona discovers the area's ancient history in the form of the Rodney carving, dating from the 8th century, when the area was inhabited by the Celtic-speaking Picts. The Picts were known for their intricate carvings of people and standing stones like the Celtic cross that now stands proud in Brodie Castle's grounds.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
channel.desc: Paul and Bob travel with their trusty terrier Ted to fish the mighty river Trent in Nottingham in search of a barbel. In the large, wide river, they can sense the presence of big barbel, but will they land one?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Clara Amfo, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley are live as the sun begins to set on the final day of Glastonbury Festival.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Past Lives
channel.desc: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Decades later, they are reunited for one fateful week as they confront destiny, love and the choices that make a life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bonnie and Clyde
channel.desc: Celebrated tale about the rise and fall of two violent young outlaws and their gang, based on the lives of the two most notorious American outlaws of the 1930s - Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. The film became a cinematic landmark because of its groundbreaking, realistic and brutal scenes of violence, and won two Oscars.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: A reclusive millionaire is found murdered in his home in west London, and police find hundreds of thousands of pounds in cash there. Why have his killers not taken the money? Only old-fashioned detective work can find them, but they have fled abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of delicious recipes from Rosie Birkett, Mike Reid, Danilo Cortellini and Genevieve Taylor. And Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out and about across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: There are updates from live nest cameras on site at the Longshaw Estate, where Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are poised to capture the beauty of the season. Iolo Williams is broadcasting live from the spectacular Rathlin Island Seabird Centre.

channel.name: BBC Two NL

channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from the opening day of the 2025 Championships at Wimbledon, with the 128 players in the men's and women's singles draws dreaming of glory at the All England Club. Among them are Spain's Carlos Alcaraz, who is aiming to win the title for the third year in a row, and who arrives in south west London in top form after retaining his French Open title by beating world number one Jannik Sinner in an unforgettable final in Paris. Introduced by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Clare Balding presents continuing live coverage from Wimbledon, where the 2025 Championships are in full swing. Eighth-ranked Zheng Qinwen was the highest seed to lose on the first day in 2024. However, the Chinese player bounced back to win the Olympic title the following month and is back this year, hoping for better luck on the grass at the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: EastEnders
channel.desc: Residents of Albert Square in London's East End deal with life, love and loss. The long-running and popular soap opera focuses on family relationships and a sense of belonging in the community, and has been known to tackle hard-hitting topics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: EastEnders
channel.desc: Residents of Albert Square in London's East End deal with life, love and loss. The long-running and popular soap opera focuses on family relationships and a sense of belonging in the community, and has been known to tackle hard-hitting topics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Agata and David live in Benfleet, Essex. They were initially attracted to their lovely new family home because of its massive garden. They thought it would be an ideal space for their autistic son Franik to enjoy being outside. However, they soon found that the size and awkward L-shape was a problem, because it was difficult to keep an eye on him. They are constantly concerned that Franik could hurt himself.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: After a long break, Martin Scarsden returns to his hometown in the hopes of spending a quiet vacation with his new partner, Mandy Bond. But his plans take a turn when his mate Jasper Speight is found dead and the only witness and suspect is Mandy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: It's April, and in one the region's most sheltered harbours, local crab fishermen are making the most of the ideal conditions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Upstart Crow
channel.desc: Will is off to Stratford to get some serious writing done, but his bullying former school teacher invites himself to stay. Will has to confront his childhood demons, and it soon turns out there's more at stake.

channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Alison has an epiphany; Kyle recounts painful childhood memories; Boris explores the roots of his restlessness; Orna encourages Nick to open up.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Nick reveals a traumatic episode that shaped his relationship with Katherine; Rod pushes back on Alison; Orna is met with defiance from Boris.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: The roadshow is at Firstsite contemporary art gallery in Colchester, Essex, where treasures include a spin painting by Damien Hirst, a watch with a racy past and logbooks from the real-life `Great Escape'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lifeline
channel.desc: Joely Richardson presents an appeal on behalf of `Supporting Wounded Veterans', a charity that supports ex-service personnel as they transition into civilian life, through mentoring, sport rehabilitation and pain management programmes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: Two people die in an arson attack on their home, but police can't get a DNA profile from matches left at the scene. Then, an eagle-eyed detective clocks a problem with the CCTV footage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Bag maker Neil pitches an idea for an old tent, and JJ Chalmers tries a first, turning a sewing machine stand into seating.

channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Live action from day two of Wimbledon, where the world's top tennis players have gathered to battle it out at the third grand slam of the season. As is tradition, the first match on Centre Court on the second day of the Championships features the defending women's champion, with Barbora Krejcikova of the Czech Republic getting proceedings under way in the world's most iconic tennis arena. Presented by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Clare Balding hosts further live coverage of the 2025 Championships at Wimbledon. Left-hander Jack Draper was among the winners on this day last year and the Briton has had a fantastic last 12 months, including reaching the semi-finals of the US Open and racing up the world rankings, so he will have high hopes of reaching the latter stages at his home grand slam.

channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: As Martin continues to investigate the events surrounding Jasper's murder, he and Mandy learn that someone, probably Jasper, drugged her; when family members discuss an old betrayal with Martin, Mandy becomes concerned about their relationship.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: In the north east of England lies a wild and remote moorland. This ancient landscape of heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales is home to red grouse and tough moorland sheep.

channel.title: The Moment of Proof

channel.desc: Isa Guha introduces live coverage from day four of Wimbledon, one of the highlights of the sporting summer. On this day in 2024, British wild card Jacob Fearnley took a set off seven-time champion Novak Djokovic on Centre Court. It proved to be real springboard for the Scot, who has powered up the rankings this year to earn direct entry into the Wimbledon draw.
